column4: i’m trying to connect to an open wlan via the console. with network manager it works. when i use iwconfig ath0 essid "ESSID", iwconfig shows me the essid, but no ap or channel is shown. Has anyone an idea how I could connect?
try to obtain  an ip with dhclient or dhcpcd or whatever you are using
and what about link quality shown when you done iwconfig ath0
dhclient doesn‘t get me an ip and afterwards the AP and channel are still not set
the wlan is open btw
try iwconfig ath0 ap "ESSID"
by the way, do you get anything when you do iwlist ath0 s can
ath0 is up
yes, I get a list with all networks
when you done iwconfig ath0 essid "YourEssid" then iwconfig you can't see your essid here, that's your problem. can you check in which mode your ath0 is?  Monitor, managed?
it's enough to set ap for an open network
ath0 is managed
iwconfig sets the essid, but AP is shown not associated and channel is shown 0
try iwconfig channel "Channel" essid "ESSID" rate auto
but it isn't necessary to do that
there should be a mac filter if you can't connect even with the last command
there can‘t be a mac filter, as i can connect with network-manager, it just doesn‘t work from the console. but i’ll try this command
i still get AP: Not associated with this last command
i’ve got the feeling that this command doesn‘t really do anything, it quits instantaniously and tha wlan led doesnt blink
wlanconfig ath0 destroy && wlanconfig ath0 create wlandev wifi0 wlanmode sta
it's normal. it actually seems like to do nothing but it does. and the leds cannot be work unless you've done some special settings. by the way, why you're insisting to connect via command line
still the same... it’s not really important that I can connect, I just thought it would be nice to be able to do it from the console and as it didn’t work I wanted to know if I do something wrong.
unop: thanks for your help anyway
nope. i really wonder why you can't. i'm creating a tool that allow users to connect from console easily like gui. i'll inform you later
